body:
When running `kubectl get all` I can see the different types of resources running in the cluster but if I want to delete/remove/get one of the resources I don't know what type it is.

e.g.

``` sh
$ kubectl get all --all-namespaces
NAMESPACE     NAME                DESIRED        CURRENT            AGE
kube-system   kube-dns-v9         1              1                  26m
NAMESPACE     NAME                CLUSTER-IP     EXTERNAL-IP        PORT(S)         AGE
default            kubernetes          172.23.0.1     <none>             443/TCP         45m
kube-system   kube-dns            172.23.0.100   <none>             53/UDP,53/TCP   26m
NAMESPACE     NAME                READY          STATUS             RESTARTS        AGE
default       kube-proxy-node1   1/1            Running            0               35m
default       kube-proxy-node2   1/1            Running            0               33m
default       kube-proxy-node3   1/1            Running            0               32m
kube-system   kube-dns-v9-yoir3   3/4            CrashLoopBackOff   7               26m
```

But if I want to do anything with kube-dns-v9 I have to know what resource type it is.

The header row should say what type of objects it is listing so I can more easily get details about the objects.

e.g.

``` sh
(ReplicationControllers) NAMESPACE     NAME                DESIRED        CURRENT            AGE
kube-system   kube-dns-v9         1              1                  26m
(Services) NAMESPACE     NAME                CLUSTER-IP     EXTERNAL-IP        PORT(S)         AGE
default            kubernetes          172.23.0.1     <none>             443/TCP         45m
kube-system   kube-dns            172.23.0.100   <none>             53/UDP,53/TCP   26m
(Pods) NAMESPACE     NAME                READY          STATUS             RESTARTS        AGE
default       kube-proxy-node1   1/1            Running            0               35m
default       kube-proxy-node2   1/1            Running            0               33m
default       kube-proxy-node3   1/1            Running            0               32m
kube-system   kube-dns-v9-yoir3   3/4            CrashLoopBackOff   7               26m
```

Or maybe it'd be helpful for interactive usage to leave off the headers and add a new column with TYPE

``` sh
NAMESPACE     NAME                DESIRED        CURRENT            AGE     TYPE
kube-system       kube-dns-v9     1              1                 26m       rc
```

This would make other cli tools (grep, awk) much easier to use with `kubectl` output because then I can do something like `kubectl get all --all-namespaces | grep rc` and get all of the replication controllers. I know I can use `kubectl get rc` but there are still more powerful cli tools that I may want like excluding rc ( `grep -v rc` ) or printing and looping on a specific column from the output (eg `kubectl get all | grep -v ing | awk '{print $2}'` )
title: kubectl get all should show resource types in headers or column
